results.title: Engineer Warned of ‘Major Structural Damage’ at Florida Condo Complex
results.abstract: A consultant in 2018 urged the managers to repair cracked columns and crumbling concrete. The work was finally about to get underway when the building collapsed.
results.byline: By Mike Baker, Anjali Singhvi and Patricia Mazzei

multimedia.caption: Images from a 2018 report by structural engineer Frank Morabito on the Champlain Towers South condomium.

results.title: Anxious Residents of Sister Tower to Fallen Florida Condo Wonder: Stay or Go?
results.abstract: The partly collapsed Champlain Towers South scared people who live in Champlain Towers North. But no one has ordered them to evacuate — yet.
results.byline: By Kimiko de Freytas-Tamura, Patricia Mazzei and Joseph B. Treaster

multimedia.caption: The Champlain Towers North, center, among other high rise condominiums in Surfside, Fla. The mayor of Surfside said there are roughly 20 buildings with 12 stories that overlook the ocean in his town.
multimedia.copyright: Scott McIntyre for The New York Times

results.title: How Deceptive Campaign Fund-Raising Ensnares Older People
results.abstract: Older Americans, a critical source of political donations, often fall victim to aggressive and misleading digital practices. A broad Times analysis points to the scope of the problem.

multimedia.caption: William W. Vaughan Jr.’s credit card statement is dominated by recurring donations to a variety of Republican candidates, processed through WinRed. Mr. Vaughan’s personal information has been redacted.

results.title: Officer Injured in Capitol Riot Asks McCarthy to Disavow Lies About It
results.abstract: Officer Michael Fanone, who was seriously injured by the pro-Trump mob, said he came away disappointed from his meeting with the top House Republican.

multimedia.caption: Michael Fanone, left, a Washington police officer, and Officer Harry Dunn of the U.S. Capitol Police leaving a meeting with Representative Kevin McCarthy, the House minority leader, at the Capitol on Friday.
multimedia.copyright: J. Scott Applewhite/Associated Press

multimedia.caption: Michael Fanone, left, a Washington police officer, and Officer Harry Dunn of the U.S. Capitol Police leaving a meeting with Representative Kevin McCarthy, the House minority leader, at the Capitol on Friday.

results.title: As Parents Forbid Covid Shots, Defiant Teenagers Seek Ways to Get Them
results.abstract: Most medical consent laws require parental permission for minors to get a vaccine. Now some places are easing restrictions for Covid shots while others are proposing new ones.

multimedia.caption: When the mother of this Florida teenager blocked her from getting the Covid vaccine, the 15-year-old was uninvited to a friend’s party and continues to feel excluded from many social events because she remains unvaccinated.
multimedia.copyright: Maria Alejandra Cardona for The New York Times

results.title: 1+1=4? Latin America Confronts a Pandemic Education Crisis.
results.abstract: With economies reeling and millions cut off from the classroom, Latin America’s students are leaving school in alarming numbers, experts say.
results.byline: By Julie Turkewitz and Federico Rios

multimedia.caption: Gloria Vásquez with her 8-year-old daughter, Ximena, at their home in Soacha, Colombia.
